required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Effects of Multiple Dose Regimens of CHF 5074 on Potential Biomarkers of Neurodegeneration in Subjects With Mild Cognitive Impairment
clinical_study.official_title: A Double-Blind, Randomized, Placebo-Controlled, Multicenter Study to Evaluate the Effects of Multiple Dose Regimens of CHF 5074 for up to 2 Years on Potential Biomarkers of Neurodegeneration in Subjects With Mild Cognitive Impairment

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate the effects of multiple dose regimens of CHF 5074 administered once per day up to 2 years on potential biomarkers of neurodegeneration in subjects with mild cognitive impairment.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Caregiver, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Prevention

primary_outcome.measure: To determine the effects on change from baseline on brain atrophy

secondary_outcome.measure: To determine the presence of other biomarkers of neuronal degeneration
To determine the presence of other biomarkers of neuronal degeneration

other_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in cognitive performance
Change from baseline in global clinical status

intervention.description: oral tablet, 1x, once a day for 24 months
oral tablet, 2x, once a day for 24 months
oral tablet,once a day for 24 months

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- One or two ∆ê4 alleles of the apolipoprotein E (APOE) gene.
- Diagnosis of amnestic Mild Cognitive Impairment.
- Mini-Mental State Examination score higher than 24 at screening.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of Alzheimer's disease.
- Any medical condition that could explain the subject's cognitive deficits.
- MRI scans having evidence of pre-specified brain abnormalities.
- History of stroke.
- Vitamin B12 or folate deficiency.
- Skin cancers and any cancer that is being actively treated.
- Diagnosis of schizophrenia or recurrent mood disorder.
- Abnormal kidney function.
- Concomitant use of any study prohibitive medication.
